item.title: Michael O’Brien set to lead Liberal Party after Victorian election loss - Herald Sun
item.description:
Michael O’Brien set to lead Liberal Party after Victorian election loss  Herald Sun

Former state treasurer Michael O'Brien appears set to take leadership of the Victorian Liberals and begin the mammoth task of rebuilding a shattered party room.

item.title: New Lib leader claims the centre - The Australian
item.description:
New Lib leader claims the centre  The Australian

Victoria’s new Liberal leader has vowed to function as a centrist who is mindful of climate change but does not want to get overwhelmed by dysfunctional internal analysis. Michael O’Brien, 47, is a former senior adviser to federal treasurer Peter Costello, and was elevated to the leadership yesterday after the November 24 rout led to Matthew Guy’s resignation. Mr O’Brien will implement an overhaul of the party just months from a federal election and try to unite depleted forces without a permanent party president. Rural MP Cindy McLeish was elected his deputy, veteran frontbencher David Dav...

item.title: Guy quits as Victorian Opposition Leader after election disaster - ABC News
item.description:
Guy quits as Victorian Opposition Leader after election disaster  ABC News

By state political reporter Richard Willingham and staff Victoria's defeated Opposition Leader Matthew Guy has stood down from the Liberal Party leadership in the wake of Saturday's electoral rout. In a brief statement, Mr Guy expressed his "deep appreciation" for the support and unity of his Liberal colleagues throughout his leadership. Mr Guy's resignation was widely expected by his colleagues after the Liberals saw a swing of about 6 per cent swing against them. Much of the criticism of the electoral disaster was initially directed at party president Michael Kroger, but there was also cr...

item.title: Analysis: Victorian election disaster prompts Liberal search for Matthew Guy replacement - ABC News
item.description:
Analysis: Victorian election disaster prompts Liberal search for Matthew Guy replacement  ABC News

The electoral wound inflicted on the Liberal Party by voters in Victoria is likely to get much worse before it begins to heal, with the party riven by bloodletting. Key points: - Matthew Guy is expected to stand down after the Liberals suffered a 6.1 per cent swing - John Pesutto is considered a frontrunner for the role, but is in a fight to win his seat - Michael O'Brien, the treasurer in the last Coalition government, is also a strong contender It remains unclear whether Matthew Guy will stay on as Opposition Leader after the electoral rout, with Mr Guy maintaining radio silence since the...

item.title: Victorian Liberals search for new leader as post-election blame game intensifies - ABC News
item.description:
Victorian Liberals search for new leader as post-election blame game intensifies  ABC News

By state political reporter Richard Willingham The electoral wound inflicted on the Liberal Party by voters in Victoria is likely to get much worse before it begins to heal, with the party riven by bloodletting. It remains unclear whether Matthew Guy will stay on as Opposition Leader after the electoral rout, with Mr Guy maintaining radio silence since the humiliating defeat. There is an expectation he will stand aside. Discussions about potential successors are in their infancy, but are quietly occurring. Those conversations are complicated by the fact that mooted candidate John Pesutto is...

item.title: Analysis: Victoria shuns Coalition fear campaign as voters reward nuanced leadership - ABC News
item.description:
Analysis: Victoria shuns Coalition fear campaign as voters reward nuanced leadership  ABC News

By state political reporter Richard Willingham The state has embraced Daniel Andrews's agenda of building major infrastructure and continued investment in schools and hospitals. Building projects create jobs and stimulate the economy. These are things the public expect their state government to do and Premier Andrews and his team delivered this in spades in their first term. On energy, Labor ignored the hot air on the climate change debate and simply forged ahead with ambitious renewable energy targets, which voters have embraced. The Andrews Government also managed to take on bold social p...

item.title: Uproar as MP branded a ‘liar’ - The Australian
item.description:
Uproar as MP branded a ‘liar’  The Australian

Mr Nardella attended his first question time since being forced to resign from the Labor Party after being found to have taken $175,000 in payments from a living allowance intended for country MPs living away from home. However, his return to the chamber triggered a firestorm when he attempted to ask a question of Emergency Services Minister and Deputy Premier James Merlino and was met with shouts from across the chamber. “It’s bad enough to sit here listening to this dirty rotten liar ... this is an absolute disgrace,” Liberal MP Brian Paynter told parliament, before demanding Speaker Coli...

item.title: Nardella branded a ‘dirty liar’ - The Australian
item.description:
Nardella branded a ‘dirty liar’  The Australian

Mr Nardella attended his first question time since being forced to resign from the Labor Party after being found to have taken home $175,000 in payments from a living allowance intended for country MPs living away from home. But his return to the chamber triggered a firestorm when he attempted to ask a question of Emergency Services Minister and Deputy Premier James Merlino and was met with shouts from across the chamber. “It’s bad enough to sit here listening to this dirty rotten liar ... this is an absolute disgrace,” Liberal MP Brian Paynter told parliament, before issuing an ultimatum t...

item.title: Victorian Government bows to calls to release controversial China deal - ABC News
item.description:
Victorian Government bows to calls to release controversial China deal  ABC News

The Victorian Government has released an agreement it signed with China over its controversial global infrastructure initiative, after several days of pressure from the Opposition and the Federal Government. Key points: - The Victorian Government says the deal does not bind the state to be involved in any specific project - The Opposition says it has concerns about the impact on Victorian businesses - 68 countries have signed up to President Xi Jinping's signature initiative The four-page Memorandum of Understanding, posted online late on Sunday, says the two parties will "work together wit...

item.title: Minister accuses Liberals of 'race-baiting', following Trump playbook - ABC News
item.description:
Minister accuses Liberals of 'race-baiting', following Trump playbook  ABC News

Victorian Liberal MPs are "race-baiting" and engaging in Donald Trump-style politics, a minister in the Andrews Government has declared. Minister for Families and Children Jenny Mikakos was suspended from Parliament on Wednesday after she refused to withdraw her claim that the Liberal and National parties were racist. The comments came after a summer in which a so-called "African gang crisis" dominated public debate, with strong rhetoric from politicians about the need for tough-on-crime policies. Entering parliament on Thursday morning Ms Mikakos doubled down on her claim. "It is very clea...
